data.title: Al Jefferson
data.meta_description: Posts about Al Jefferson written by Andy Wittry
data.text:
There are two big milestones that I’ve reached today. I broke the 2,000 view barrier early this morning and this is my 125th blog post. Thank you for continuing to read my blog and hopefully there will be more milestones in the future.

I was listening to one of my favorite radio shows, The Thundering Herd with Colin Cowherd, two days ago and he did a segment where he described all 32 NFL teams in three words. I thought it was very creative and entertaining so I thought I would give it a try for the NBA.

Atlanta Hawks

Eastern Conference sleeper

Boston Celtics

Watch out Heat

Brooklyn Nets

What could’ve been…(If they could have pulled off the Dwight Howard trade)

Charlottle Bobcats

Worst team again

Chicago Bulls

Need Rose healthy

Cleveland Cavaliers

Almost becoming watchable

Dallas Mavericks

Entirely new roster

Denver Nuggets

Young, exciting, developing

Detroit Pistons

Some promising youth

Golden State Warriors

Will exceed expectations

Houston Rockets

Rookies! Bad signings

Indiana Pacers

Need a star

Los Angeles Clippers

Second in L.A.

Los Angeles Lakers

Western Conference’s Finest

Miami Heat

Improved bench; Repeat

Memphis Grizzlies

Avoid in playoffs

Milwaukee Bucks

Ellis shoots again

Minnesota Timberwolves

The white-skinned wonders

New Orleans Hornets

Very good starters

New York Knicks

Melo = No championship

Oklahoma City Thunder

Top three team

Orlando Magic

Bottom of standings

Philadelphia 76’ers

Will Bynum shine?

Phoenix Suns

Never panned out

Portland Trail Blazers

Aldridge and rookies

Sacramento Kings

College stars; sub-.500

San Antonio Spurs

Chemistry, veterans, coaching

Toronto Raptors

Who’s their star?

Utah Jazz

Jefferson. Who else?

Washington Wizards

J-Wall and J-Craw

Think you have a better three-word description? Comment below with your thoughts!
